Van Ness House

Burlington Vt.

body.p:
Han is not quite so well—rather ambitious and tried to do as ordinarily to day—yet I think she is stronger. Weather is much against her—Chilly— sheivering shivering —does not see any person yet. Visitors stay too long and talk too much, whch is very distressing—I rather discourage such—indeed I am positive at times—she appreciates any thing
coming from you most affectionately—keeps your letter in hand.
I wish she was near Lou and George—I am at times much discouraged and too nervous to wait upon her—my apprehensions professionaly professionally render me often eccentric and confused—
I shall be obliged perhaps to get an assistant, yet I hope not.
Mention to George—My anual annual interest 15 dollars only is due in November—I have 10 dollars toward it—I contrive somehow—
